abstract: Dismissing objections from executives at JPMorgan Chase and American Express, U.S. regulators insisted the banks raise equity this week before repaying bail-out funds.
snippet: Dismissing objections from executives at JPMorgan Chase and American Express, U.S. regulators insisted the banks raise equity this week before repaying bail-out funds.
lead_paragraph: Dismissing objections from executives at JPMorgan Chase and American Express, U.S. regulators insisted the banks raise equity this week before repaying bail-out funds, Reuters reported, citing an article in The Financial Times.

headline.main: U.S. Insists That Banks Raise Funds, Report Says
